title: What You Need to Know About ADHD Medications: A Guide for Families
content:
What You Need to Know About ADHD Medications: A Guide for Families 

    Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) affects millions of children and adults worldwide. For families navigating this condition, understanding ADHD medications is crucial to making informed treatment decisions. This guide will cover key medications such as Adderall and Ritalin, their uses, dosages, and potential side effects, as well as insights into newer therapies like MDMA-assisted treatments. For more reliable ADHD resources, visit ADHD Pharmaceuticals

.

Understanding ADHD Medications

ADHD medications fall into two main categories: stimulants and non-stimulants. Stimulants, including Adderall, Adderall XR, and Ritalin, are often first-line treatments. These medications work by increasing dopamine and norepinephrine levels in the brain, improving focus, attention, and impulse control. Learn more about ADHD treatment options at ADHD Pharmaceuticals .

Adderall Overview

Adderall is a combination of amphetamine salts used to treat ADHD. It comes in various forms, including:

Adderall IR (Immediate Release): Fast-acting, usually taken multiple times a day.

Adderall XR (Extended Release): Designed to last longer with once-daily dosing.

Key points for families:

Adderall dosage and Adderall XR dosage should be personalized by a healthcare provider.

Adderall generic names are available and may be more affordable.

Potential side effects include depression, erectile dysfunction, and withdrawal symptoms if discontinued abruptly.

Always follow Adderall prescription guidelines to minimize risks. For detailed guides on Adderall and ADHD care, visit ADHD Pharmaceuticals .

Ritalin Overview

Ritalin (methylphenidate) is another widely prescribed ADHD medication. Families may encounter questions like Ritalin vs Adderall, or about dosing options such as Ritalin 10 mg, Ritalin 20 mg, Ritalin 30 mg, and Ritalin 40 mg.

Important considerations:

Ritalin generic name is available for cost-effective options.

Ritalin dosing should always be guided by a clinician, based on age, weight, and ADHD severity.

Possible side effects include mood changes, sleep disturbances, and Ritalin depression in some cases. For trusted information on Ritalin and other ADHD medications, visit ADHD Pharmaceuticals .

Emerging Therapies: MDMA

While stimulants like Adderall and Ritalin remain primary treatments, research into MDMA-assisted therapy is expanding, particularly for mental health conditions such as PTSD and anxiety. Key points include:

MDMA effects include increased empathy, emotional openness, and mood elevation.

MDMA side effects can range from elevated heart rate to anxiety.

Clinical trials are investigating MDMA therapy under professional supervision. Learn more about emerging therapies and ongoing research at ADHD Pharmaceuticals .

Getting ADHD and Mental Health Medications Online

In today’s digital age, many families seek guidance on how to access ADHD or anxiety medications safely online. Common questions include:

How to get an anxiety medication prescription

How to get anxiety medication prescribed online

Online depression prescription or medication without insurance

Important tips:

Always use licensed telehealth providers to ensure prescriptions are safe and legal.

Avoid unverified sources that sell Adderall pills, Ritalin medication, or antidepressants without proper medical oversight. For trusted advice on online prescriptions, visit ADHD Pharmaceuticals 

              Managing ADHD is a journey that combines medication, behavioral strategies, and family support. Understanding the differences between Adderall, Ritalin, and emerging therapies like MDMA empowers families to make informed treatment choices. Always consult healthcare professionals before starting, adjusting, or switching medications.

Reliable ADHD care begins with knowledge, careful monitoring, and professional guidance.

For comprehensive guides and resources, visit ADHD Pharmaceuticals .

References / Resources:

[[ADHD Pharmaceuticals|https://adhdpharmaceuticals.com/]]

FDA Drug Database: Adderall and Ritalin

Clinical research on MDMA-assisted therapyhttps://adhdpharmaceuticals.com/
creator: tonypillow095@gmail.com

title: PEC in entrata e uscita
content: Buongiorno, con la mia pec mail "@ingpec.eu" riesco ad inviare oppure a ricevere le mail, ma non insieme. Mi spiego meglio, da impostazioni account di Thunder, mi permette di inserire il server di posta in uscita (smtps.pec.aruba.it) con la porta 465 standard (ovviamente immetto la pass "temporanea" di aruba). Facendo così, invio le mail ma non le ricevo! Se cambio le impostazioni ed inserisco la porta 993, ricevo le mail ma non le invio! Non trovo nelle impostazioni il server in "entrata" ma solo in uscita... mi potete aiutare? Grazie
creator: docfamily2021

title: Anomalie con cartelle account PEC
content: Ho installato Thunderbird 142.0 in un PC con Windows 11 Professional Ver. 24H2, ed ho creato 2 account: 1 di posta elettronica normale, ed uno di una PEC. Gli account sono stati creati correttamente, però con la PEC rilevo le seguenti anomalie di funzionamento: 1) i messaggi di posta elettronica presenti sul Server di posta antecedenti l'installazione non vengono scaricati; 2) quando invio un messaggio dalla PEC la mia copia finisce in Cartelle locali => Posta inviata. Nessun problema invece con l'account di posta normale. Ho provato quindi ad installare Thunderbird su un'altro PC, ma succede la stessa cosa. Sapete dirmi qualcosa ? Grazie.
creator: wolfenstein18

title: Webcal support for internet calendars
content:
I am using Thunderbird 128.14.0esr on Debian. I tried to import an internet calendar but it was unable to find it until I changed `webcal://` to `https://`.

The issue is basically resolved already by replacing webcal in the URI but it might be better to add support for this scheme too.

title: Chiusura di Thunderbird
content: Buon giorno, ho Thunderbird su MacBook Pro, la versione è 140.0.1 64 bit, chiudo il programma normalmente, mi compare una schermata dal titolo "Chiusura inattesa di Thunderbird", una lunga lista di "Dettagli del problema e configurazione di sistema" e due scelte finali, "Ok" o "Riapri", io ovviamente premo "Ok" e scompare la schermata. Ad ogni riutilizzo di Thunderbird, si ripresenta il problema alla chiusura. Il problema si presenta dall'inizio di settembre 2025 circa. Allego due immagini, con la prima schermata e lìultima parte della lunga lista dei "Dettagli..."

title: Thunderbird for gmail archiving - All Mail help please
content:
Hi, Forums - I am a new Thunderbird user based on on-line research suggesting Thunderbird as the best way to relieve gmail account with local mailbox archiving. My gmail is out of storage by end of the month and my plan was to move a bunch of old messages into local Thunderbird mailbox to clear room in the google account. I have set up Thunderbird successfully with gmail using IMAP connectivity option. Thunderbird shows same folder structure as labels in gmail and displays all messages from the oldest to newest. So then I tried the "archiving" by setting up a folder structure under Thunderbird's Local Folders. Specifically, to start with I I set up Inbox_archive and Sent_archive and used right click Move To > Local Folders > Folder name to move old messages from live ...@gmail.com tree to Local Folder tree. Since there is also an option Copy To, my understanding was that Move should be different from Copy by also removing messages from gmail and move them to Local folders. At a first glance these steps seemed to work. I see unique old messages in Thuderbird Local Folders. I don't see these messages in Thunderbird's gmail inbox/sent and I also don't see these messages when I search in on-line gmail in:inbox and in:sent. I noticed, however, that google storage size didn't budge. I moved a thousand of more messages in the same way (thinking maybe older messages were just small) and the storage still didn't decrease. I then looked around in on-line gmail and found the messages that I presumed "archived" still sitting in gmail's All Mail. This explains why the storage size didn't change. I searched on the forum and on-line and can't get a confident answer on what am I missing to actually remove the messages from gmail - ideally in the most straightforward manner in one action as a cut and paste from on-line to local folders. Are there any SMTP settings that I should have so that Thunderbird's "Move to" actually removes messages from on-line account? Or is there a different archiving command/strategy I need to use?

I am hesitant to do any more trial and error on my own since I already messed up my gmail by having now thousands of messages still sitting in All Mail without proper Inbox and Sent tags and, thus, would appreciate the recommendation from someone who is familiar with my use case.

Thank you.
creator: gupetrov

title: Thunderbird hangs when I'm replying to another email
content:
In recent weeks, Thunderbird often hangs when I'm replying to another email and have written a sentence or two. It never recovers, and I have to close the program from Windows.

It doesn't always do this. On a few occasions, if I wait a while, close Thunderbird from Windows, and restart it, the partial is in the Drafts folder.

I'm running Windows 11 24H2, but I've been on 24H2 since December, and this problem is more recent.
